white: A soprano, late to rehearsal, holding a pumpkin spice latte.
A quiet alto who secretly watches people sleep through their bedroom windows.
A nuanced criticism from the director.
Altos finally getting the melody and trying play it cool.
A Sally Albrecht piece that I can get behind.
“We’ll run it one more time” and other director lies.
Believing you remember the alto part to the Hallelujah Chorus (Psst... you don’t).

A tenor with a leaky wound.

Standing next to the perpetually flat alto.

An awkward handshake that doesn’t quite connect.

Navy blue socks with tuxedo pants.

Getting kicked out of a choir Facebook group.
Consistently singing my music a half-step flat.

That one kid who thinks they can beatbox but just spits a little.

Bass notes that are only attainable during allergy season.

Yelling “Fire!” Into an unattended PA system.
